page.title: 15Customs of the Past (2)
page.content: When the Rev.J.F.Warden was vicar soon after the First World War,he and his wife began a Shrove Tuesday Tea for the whole village which was held in the Institute.This became a social event which seemed to lapse when he retired in 1940. Harvest Festival is the Sunday after the 11th October.Years ago it was the start of Wakes Week.It was a week when relatives would try to return home.The eating of a plum pudding was a special feature of table fare that week.There would be a public dance most evenings of the week.The associated fair with swing boats,coconut shies and other stalls continued until about 1960 but Wakes Week declined earlier. It has been suggested that the PCC should organise a Harvest Supper to be followed by a Social Evening.
